content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --SEQ
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - DOMAIN
        - USUBJID
        - --TESTCD
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0019
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error if records are not unique as per sponsor defined key variables
  as documented in the define.xml
Outcome:
  Message: Records are not unique as per sponsor defined key variables as documented
    in the define.xml
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0019
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Note that the key variables shown in this table are
                  examples only. A sponsor's actual key structure may be different.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Section: Table 3.2.1
              - Cited Guidance: Since the purpose of this column is to aid reviewers
                  in understanding the structure of a dataset, sponsors should list
                  all of the natural keys (see definition below) for the dataset.
                  These keys should define uniqueness for records within a dataset,
                  and may define a record sort order. The identified keys for each
                  dataset should be consistent with the description of the dataset
                  structure as described in the Define-XML document.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Section: 3.2.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Trigger error if records are not unique as per sponsor defined key variables as documented in the define.xml

Outcome.Message: Records are not unique as per sponsor defined key variables as documented in the define.xml

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Note that the key variables shown in this table are examples only. A sponsor's actual key structure may be different.

Since the purpose of this column is to aid reviewers in understanding the structure of a dataset, sponsors should list all of the natural keys (see definition below) for the dataset. These keys should define uniqueness for records within a dataset, and may define a record sort order. The identified keys for each dataset should be consistent with the description of the dataset structure as described in the Define-XML document.
